module.name: wiring_harness_assembly_design
module.keywords: module, harness, electrical, assembly, design, wire, cable, connector, terminal, joint, splice

inscope.li: electrical definition of a wiring harness;
modifications made to the cables and wires to be used in the harness;
assembly joints, each of which specify the mechanical connection between two terminals;
requirement allocation from the physical connectivity definition to the implementing item in the wire list;
assembly_joint that reference an external item;
segment topology of an electrical harness;
cross section structure of harness segments;
marking of harness components and topology segments;
items within the scope of application module Wire and cable design connectivity, ISO/TS 10303-1845;
items within the scope of application module Extruded structure cross section, ISO/TS 10303-1827;
items within the scope of application module Edge based topological representation with length, ISO/TS 10303-1830.

definition.def: connector accessory that is closing a connector from the back side and guide the wires and cables
fixing device for a cable on a structure
plug for a connector cavity for the purpose of sealing
cavity in a connector, connector housing or insert intended to receive a connector contact or multi-contact
contact member that is intended to be contained in a connector

collection of connector parts that are intended to be assembled together and that contain at least one connector housing and that may contain alternative parts that may or may not be used in the final assembly
backshell that is intended to be conductive
connector housing that shields against electromagnetic interference

element of the topological structure of a wiring harness for the representation of a topological vertex in which one or several harness segments ends and to which a connector or terminal may be associated
topological structure of a wiring harness consisting of harness segments for the edges and harness nodes for the vertices
element of the topological structure of a wiring harness for the representation of a topological edge and that contains wires or cables that may be enwrapped by a sheath
part that is intended to attach written information to other parts
sheath that is also a braid
mechanical object that helps join other mechanical objects together by preventing leakage, containing pressure, or excluding contamination
drawing of a wiring harness that represents the harness topology with arbitrary scale factors and proportions
drawing of a wiring harness that represents the harness topology in real size
opening in a connector housing to receive a connector insert
connector accessory to guide and provide strain relief to wires and cables

assembly with a harness topology, consisting of cables or wires to enable electrical or optical connectivity, grouped together in one or more harness segments, each between two harness nodes in which the cables or wires either switch to other harness nodes or in which the cables and wires ends in connectors, contact members or terminal lugs

aa.refpath: harness_node <= shape_aspect = represented_definition <- item_identified_representation_usage.definition -> item_identified_representation_usage { item_identified_representation_usage => geometric_item_specific_usage } item_identified_representation_usage.identified_item -> representation_item => topological_representation_item => vertex

harness_node <= shape_aspect <- shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect shape_aspect_relationship { shape_aspect_relationship.name = 'attached feature' } shape_aspect_relationship.related_shape_aspect -> shape_aspect

shape_aspect shape_aspect.of_shape -> product_definition_shape <= property_definition property_definition.definition -> characterized_definition = characterized_product_definition = product_definition

harness_node <= shape_aspect = represented_definition <- item_identified_representation_usage.definition -> item_identified_representation_usage {item_identified_representation_usage => geometric_item_specific_usage } item_identified_representation_usage.identified_item -> representation_item => topological_representation_item => edge

harness_node <= shape_aspect <- shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect { shape_aspect_relationship.name='cross section' } shape_aspect_relationship.related_shape_aspect -> shape_aspect => cross_sectional_part_shape_element => cross_sectional_group_shape_element

harness_node <= shape_aspect <- shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect { shape_aspect_relationship.name='cross section' } shape_aspect_relationship.related_shape_aspect -> shape_aspect => cross_sectional_occurrence_shape_element

harness_node <= shape_aspect <- shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect { shape_aspect_relationship.name='cross section' } shape_aspect_relationship.related_shape_aspect -> shape_aspect => cross_sectional_part_shape_element => cross_sectional_group_shape_element

harness_segment <= shape_aspect = shape_definition = characterized_definition <- property_definition.definition property_definition {property_definition.name 'forced length'} property_definition = represented_definition <- property_definition_representation property_definition_representation.used_representation -> representation representation.items[i] -> representation_item => measure_representation_item <= measure_with_unit => length_measure_with_unit

shape_aspect shape_aspect.of_shape -> product_definition_shape <= property_definition property_definition.definition -> characterized_definition = characterized_product_definition = product_definition

ae.refpath: product_definition product_definition <- product_definition_context_association.definition product_definition_context_association {product_definition_context_association.role -> product_definition_context_role product_definition_context_role.name = 'part definition type'} product_definition_context_association.frame_of_reference -> product_definition_context product_definition_context <= application_context_element application_context_element.name = 'wiring harness assembly design'

aa.refpath: product_definition = characterized_product_definition = characterized_definition <- property_definition.definition property_definition {property_definition.name 'topology'} property_definition = represented_definition <- property_definition_representation property_definition_representation.used_representation -> representation => connected_edge_with_length_set_representation
